summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and Victim Services Division (VSD) staff discussing plans for notifying victims of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment. The correspondence outlines a two-tier notification strategy: phone calls to attorneys for statutory victims and written letters to a broader group of Epstein victims.

persons.name: AUSAs
persons.context: Mentioned as the officials who will make phone call notifications to attorneys representing the statutory victims in the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Victim Notification Planning Call
events.description: A scheduled conference call between AUSAs and Victim Services Division staff to finalize procedures for notifying victims of the Epstein indictment.

keyFacts: The document reveals a planned two-tier victim notification strategy for the Epstein indictment: phone calls to attorneys for statutory victims and written letters to a broader group.
The notification plan aims to avoid confusion by carefully wording letters and limiting phone calls to those made directly by AUSAs.
The correspondence indicates that the vast majority of Epstein victims are represented by counsel in connection with the case or civil litigation.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Victim Services Division to ensure proper victim notification procedures are followed.
